text: UNIVERSAL FORMATS Most DBMSs use a proprietary on-disk binary file format for their databases. — Think of the page types... The only way to share data between systems is to convert data into a common text-based format — Examples: CSV, JSON, XML There are new open-source binary file formats - that make it easier to access data across systems. £2CMUDB P i;— 040 Z ‘ = 4« » PI o) 1:1805/1:25:14 5 $ — O . 24 - Distributed OLAP Databases (CMU Databases Systems / Fall 2019)
